org.objectstyle.cayenne.event
Class EventBridge

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.objectstyle.cayenne.event.EventBridge
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaGroupsBridge, JMSBridge
public abstract class EventBridge
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.EventListener

A bridge between Cayenne EventManager and other possible event sources. Prime example of using EventBridge is for routing events dispatched locally by EventManager to the remote JVMs via some transport mechanism (e.g. JMS). EventBridge maintains two event subjects. A "local" subject - to communicate with local EventManager, and a "remote" subject - to work with an external events interface.

If a subclass needs to prepare itself to receive incoming events it should properly implement startup(EventManager) method.

This class is an example of the "bridge" design pattern, hence the name.

Since:
1.1
Author:
Andrei Adamchik

Method Detail

convertToExternalSubject

public static java.lang.String convertToExternalSubject(EventSubject localSubject)
Performs consistent translation from EventSubjects to a String that can be used by external transport as subject for distributed communications. Substitutes all chars that can be incorrectly interpreted by whoever (JNDI, ...?).

getExternalSubject

public java.lang.String getExternalSubject()
Returns a String subject used to post distributed events.

Returns a subject used for events within the local JVM.

onExternalEvent

public void onExternalEvent(CayenneEvent event)
Helper method for sucblasses to post an event obtained from a remote source. Subclasses do not have to use this method, but they probably should for consistency.

onLocalEvent

public void onLocalEvent(CayenneEvent event)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Invoked by local EventManager when a local event of interest occurred. Internally delegates to "sendExternalEvent" abstract method.
